news.title: DJ Carey poses diplomatic dilemma for GAA as disgraced star due for All-Ireland final honour in Croke Park
news.summary: DJ Carey entered the first All-Ireland final of the new millennium under pressure.

news.title: EU ministers agree to prioritise negotiations with US to avoid threatened 30pc tariffs
‘It’s absolutely ready to live in’ – 80 families locked out of new homes waiting for link to power grid
news.summary: Half the country’s electricity substations have little or no capacity to connect new housing or other developments, analysis of the power network shows.

news.title: Met Éireann issues status yellow thunderstorm warning for 14 counties
news.summary: It’s time to pack away the deck chairs and fold up the beach towels – the mini-heatwave has come to an end.

news.title: Fionnán Sheahan: Cautious and conservative Mairead McGuinness is the polar opposite of opinionated Michael D Higgins
news.summary: Mairead McGuinness is the clear frontrunner to become our next president. Tomorrow, she will be unofficially confirmed as Fine Gael’s only nominated candidate.

news.title: Eamonn Sweeney: Jim McGuinness will prove he is the true managerial master if he can stop David Clifford
news.summary: Can you even bear to wait two weeks? This year’s football final will be one of the most eagerly anticipated ever, a heavyweight bout with a Foreman-Ali vibe.

news.title: Melanie Finn: What is the point of all these cycle paths in Dublin if no one feels safe using them?
news.summary: Having returned to work after a health event, I recently decided to start cycling to the office in a bid to improve my fitness.

news.title: My chronic pain and fatigue was put down to fibromyalgia, but it was Ehlers-Danlos Syndrome
news.summary: For as long as she can remember, Dun Laoghaire woman Ursula Hakman (59) has lived a life marked by debilitating pain. She spent her childhood years in physical agony every time she walked up or down the stairs, and battled recurring gastrointestinal problems all her life.

news.title: Ask Allison: I don’t like my teen daughter’s boyfriend. He is rude to us and they spend all their time in her bedroom
news.summary: Question:  My 16-year-old daughter has a boyfriend, and since she met him, she has dropped all her friends and all her activities. All they do is go to each other’s houses, and when they are at our house, they go into her room and close the door.

news.title: ‘I even took work when my baby was 12 weeks old, during maternity leave, just to make ends meet’ – are Irish nurses underpaid?
news.summary: Niamh O’Shea arrives on the ward before dawn, co-ordinating patient care, guiding junior staff and managing limited resources, shouldering all the responsibilities of a clinical nurse manager 2, but without the title, salary or security.
